The Battle of the Alamo started on February 23, 1836, when Mexican forces led by General Santa Anna began their siege of the Alamo mission in San Antonio, Texas. The defenders of the Alamo, including famous figures such as William Barrett Travis, James Bowie, and Davy Crockett, bravely resisted the Mexican forces. Despite Santa Anna's offer of surrender, the defenders chose to fight, inspiring others to join the Texian Army. The battle's significance in the Texas Revolution and the Texians' desire for revenge after Santa Anna's cruelty further highlight the importance of this event in shaping Texas history.

The Battle of the Alamo started on February 23, 1836.
